text:
(1)

876 Richmond Avenue, at the N. W. corner of Renfrew Place, showing the Renfrew House (Beers's 1874 map).
Mr. P. L. Sperr states that it is the house of Polly Bodine fame, in which the murder, with which her name was connected, was committed.

About 1900

By Eugene G. Putnam
From Staten Island Museum Collection through P. L. Sperr

(2) A view of the house, years later.

January 4, 1924

By William T. Davis through P. L. Sperr

(3)

A side view of the house. This view shows some slight architectural changes from that of view 1.

By William T. Davis through P. L. Sperr

(1)
848 Richmond Avenue, adjoining the N. E. corner of Renfrew Place, showing the G. Houseman House (Beers's 1874 map). Mr. P. L. Sperr states that this is the house in which Polly Brodine, who was accused in a famous murder trial, lived. By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr			October 1924

(2)
A view westward
P. L. Sperr							October 1924

(3)
An additional view, at a later date.
P. L. Sperr							March 24, 1928
